de.unisiegen.tpml.graphics.smallstep
Class SmallStepNodeComponent

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              de.unisiegen.tpml.graphics.smallstep.SmallStepNodeComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable
public class SmallStepNodeComponent
extends JComponent

The graphical representation of a de.unisiegen.tpml.core.smallstep.SmallStepProofNode.

The SmallStepNodeComponent is a bit more complicated than the node from the other two GUIs because the rules applied to this node are pointing on the expression of the next node.
To handle this right, one SmallStepNodeComponent is build like the following image shows:


Actualy there are only two elements to handle here (that is they are handled in the SmallStepComponent.placeNode(SmallStepProofNode, int, int)-method). Those two elements are the expression at the top right and the rules at the bottom left.

Because the elements of this node need to get layed out in an arrangement with the elements of the parent-node and the child-node, both components have a dimension containing the size they need for themeself and an additional information on the actual size they need to fill(this is alway more or equal as the size of itself). The rules of the parent node needs to get verticaly centered and aligned with the expression of this node. Usualy the rules are higher than the expressions. So the height of the expressionDimension is less than the actualExpressionHeight. When the expression gets placed the actualExpressionHeight is used for the height. The actualRuleHeight of the parent node than is the same as this actualExpressionHeight.
Analog the same is done for the rules of this node and the expression of the child-node. The only difference is: when the rules are placed theire vertical-center-alignment needs to get calculated menualy, because the SmallStepRulesComponent is always top-aligned.

Version:
$Rev$
Author:
Marcell Fischbach, Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
SmallStepView, SmallStepComponent, SmallStepRulesComponent, SmallStepRuleLabel, CompoundExpression, Serialized Form

Constant Field Values

proofNode

private SmallStepProofNode proofNode
The origin SmallStepProofNode

proofModel

private SmallStepProofModel proofModel
The SmallStepProofModel

rules

private SmallStepRulesComponent rules
The SmallStepRulesComponent containing the Labels of already evaluated Rules and the MenuButton for Rules not yet evaluated.

ruleDimension

private Dimension ruleDimension
The Dimension the rules needs to get drawn correctly.

actualRuleHeight

private int actualRuleHeight
The actual height the rules should use. This is >= ruleDimension.height. This height is determined by the expression height of the child node.

expression

private CompoundExpression<Location,Expression> expression
The Compound expression that is used to display the expression.

expressionDimension

private Dimension expressionDimension
The Dimension the expression needs to get drawn correctly.

actualExpressionHeight

private int actualExpressionHeight
The actual height the expression should use. This is >= expressionDimension.height. This height is determined by the rule height of the parent node.

origin

private Point origin
The top-left-most position where the entire node should located.

memoryEnabled

private boolean memoryEnabled
Flags that contains whether the expression has memory.

spacing

private int spacing
The free space in pixels that should be hold between the components

translateItem

private MenuTranslateItem translateItem
Entry within the context menu. Need to hold this value because is value can change. This item is enabled/disable in the update()-Method.

See Also:
update()

translator

private LanguageTranslator translator
Translator that is used to determine whether the expression contains syntactical sugar.

currentUnderlineExpression

private Expression currentUnderlineExpression
The expression that should be underlined. When the user moves the mouse over a rule (not not grouped rules) or the MenuButton, that a part of the entire expressions needs to get underlined.

underlineRuleAdapter

private MouseMotionAdapter underlineRuleAdapter
Adapter that is used to get added to every object that can cause the gui to underline an expression. It is bound to every SmallStepRuleLabel and to every MenuButton.

Constructor Detail

SmallStepNodeComponent

public SmallStepNodeComponent(SmallStepProofNode proofNode,
                              SmallStepProofModel proofModel,
                              LanguageTranslator translator,
                              int spacing,
                              boolean advanced)
Constructs a SmallStepNodeComponent.

All objects needed for one SmallStepNodeComponent are created and added to the JComponent.

Parameters:
proofNode - The origin node from the model.
proofModel - The model.
translator - The translator that should be used to determine whether the Expression of this node contains syntactical sugar.
spacing - The spacing between the elements of the node.
advanced - Whether the small step view operates in advanced or beginner mode.

Sets whether the small step view operates in advanced or beginner mode.

Parameters:
advanced - true to display only axiom rules in the menu.

updateUnderlineExpression

private void updateUnderlineExpression(Expression expression)
Resets the expression of the currentUnderlineExpression, if it has changed, and informs the expression-Renderer that is has changed. Causes all other nodes within the tree to free theire underlining.

Parameters:
expression -

menuItemActivated

private void menuItemActivated(JMenuItem item)
Called when an JMenuItem from the Menu was selected.

No matter what item was selected the underlining of all nodes is cleared.
There are four possible actions to be done when an item is selected.
1. a rule could have been selected, that should be used to proov this step.
2. the model should guess the current node. 3. the model should complete the entire expression 4. the model should translate the current expression into core-syntax. This item mab be disable if there is no syntactical sugar within the expression.

Parameters:
item -

setOrigion

public void setOrigion(Point origin)
Sets the top-left position where the stuff should be appear

Parameters:
origin -

setBounds

public void setBounds()
Delegate the call to the Component#setBounds(int, int, int, int) method.
The position comes directly from the origin. The size is a compined needed dimension of the ruleDimension and the expressionDimension.

update

public void update()
Causes an update of the expression and the translateItem.
Hands the store to the expression if memory is enabled.
Whether the expression of the proofNode contains syntactical sugar the translateItem is enabled or disabled at this point.

getMinRuleSize

public Dimension getMinRuleSize()
Returns the minmal size the rules need to render themself.
The actualRuleHeight is initiated at this point with the minimum height.

Returns:
The minimum size the rules need to render themself.

getRuleSize

public Dimension getRuleSize()
Returns the current ruleDimension.
This is not necessarily the minimum Size. It may be altered by setActualRuleHeight(int) and setMaxRuleWidth(int).

Returns:
Returns the currently set size of the rules.

setMaxRuleWidth

public void setMaxRuleWidth(int maxRuleWidth)
Sets the width the rules have to use.
This is needed because all rules, no matter how big they are, need to use all the same size.

Parameters:
maxRuleWidth - The width of the biggest rule within the tree.

setActualRuleHeight

public void setActualRuleHeight(int actualRuleHeight)
Sets the actual height the rule should use.
This is needed because right of this rules item the expression of the child nodes is located and they needed to be aligned.

Parameters:
actualRuleHeight -

getActualRuleHeight

public int getActualRuleHeight()
Returns the actual rule height.

Returns:
The actual rule height.

getRuleTop

public int getRuleTop()
Returns the top position of the rules.
That actualy is the bottom position of the expression added with some spacing.

Returns:

hideRules

public void hideRules()
Hides the rules.
This is done if the this node is the last node witin the tree. So no further rules could be applied.

showRules

public void showRules()
Unhides the rules.

placeRules

public void placeRules()
Causes the rules to get places.
The top position of the rules is chosen that the rules-item is verticaly centered in the space available.

freeUnderlining

private void freeUnderlining()
Causes every node, including this one, to get freed from the underlining.

freeUnderliningSibling

private void freeUnderliningSibling(boolean ignoreThis,
                                    SmallStepNodeComponent.Direction direction)
Frees every node in the given direction to be freed from the underlining. If ignoreThis is false the current nodes is freed aswell.

Parameters:
ignoreThis - Whether the current node should not be freed aswell.
direction - The direction how the freeing should be done.
